Mid-Suffolk Yard Open House at Ronkonkoma Station Today

The LIRR is holding an open house session on the Mid-Suffolk Yard Project at the Ronkonkoma Station Information Center today, 6AM to Noon. Come learn how the project would improve LIRR Ronkonkoma Branch service when East Side Access to Grand Central Terminal is completed. Speak directly with LIRR personnel and share your input about the project.

Please remember to purchase your February monthly ticket. For your convenience, ticket windows at Penn Station and Jamaica are open 24/7; check our website for window hours at other stations. Ticket machines are also available 24/7 at most LIRR stations.

LIRR customers are advised to be cautious when on station staircases and platforms and when boarding and exiting trains. Please walk, don't run on platforms and stairs and allow for extra travel time. For the latest service updates please monitor www.mta.info and follow us on Twitter and Facebook.

Come learn how the project would improve LIRR Ronkonkoma Branch service when East Side Access to Grand Central Terminal is completed. Speak directly with LIRR personnel and share your input about the project.

LIRR Station Waiting Rooms Remain Open thru Fri. Jan. 30
LIRR station waiting rooms will remain open around-the-clock through Friday afternoon, January 30, for customers waiting for trains during cold and inclement weather.

LIRR customers are advised to be cautious when on station staircases and platforms and when boarding and exiting trains. Please walk, don't run on platforms and stairs and allow for extra travel time. For the latest service updates please monitor www.mta.info and follow us on Twitter and Facebook.

Tuesday, January 27, 2015 NYC Transit began gradual restoration of service at 9 AM. Beginning at 12 noon, subway service will operate on a Sunday schedule. Bus service is being restored to a limited Sunday schedule, on a route by route basis, after a thorough route appraisal. Subway Sunday Schedule Reminder: No 5 service in Brooklyn. No 6 express service. No 7 express service. No B trains – use the ACD and/or Q instead. M service runs between Metropolitan Av and Delancey-Essex Sts only. Q service runs between Stillwell Av and 57 St-7 Av only. No Z service – use the J instead, which runs between Jamaica Center and Chambers St. Expect longer travel times. Visit www.mta.info, dial 511 or check your local news for updates. Thank you for your patience.

All planned service changes are cancelled. Subways to run as follows, but visit www.mta.info, dial 511 or check local news for updates: • Trains may run local. No express service. • B ends early. • 7 is reduced and Flushing-bound 7 use Times Sq-bound track at 5 Av and Grand Central-42 St. • Service on some subway routes may be temporarily suspended as weather conditions worsen. NYC Transit will store trains underground on express tracks starting this evening to protect the subway car fleet from the elements and ensure that trains are ready for the next rush period. This means that only local service will be available and all overnight construction work is cancelled. Personnel are in place to clear platforms and stairs of snow and ice. However, if customers must travel, they are urged to use extreme caution. Metro-North Operates Early Getaway Service in Advance of the Blizzard

In advance of Winter Storm Juno, Metro-North will operate an early getaway schedule today. Extra trains will depart Grand Central Terminal between 1 p.m. and 4 p.m., with regular schedules between 4 p.m. and 5 p.m., and fewer trains than a regular rush hour between 5 p.m. and 8 p.m. Because of reduced ridership, some trains will be cancelled or combined. Please be sure to check our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk and listen for announcements. Because of the expected severity of the storm, evening and overnight service may be further curtailed or suspended. For complete details and service updates during the storm, visit http://alert.mta.info/status/3

1, 2, 3, 5, 6, A, E, F, L, M Lines – CANCELLATION of Weeknight Planned Service Changes

With the exception of the long-term service changes on the 6 and A routes, all other planned service changes scheduled for overnight Jan 7 to 8 are cancelled. Due to the overnight forecast of sub-freezing temperatures and windy weather conditions, NYC Transit has placed into effect Winter Operations Plan No. 2. The plan calls for the underground storage of subway trains and the cancellation of overnight maintenance work, including FASTRACK. The underground storage of trains protects them from harsh conditions and ensures that they will be available and ready for morning rush service. FASTRACK operation was scheduled this week for the No. 6 Line between 125th Street and Hunts Point Avenue. However, its suspension means that subway customers will not have to transfer for shuttle buses and it will provide storage space overnight for idle No. 6 trains. Depending on the severity of weather, regular subway service may be affected. Click here for details of our Cold Weather Plan: htt
